data.text:
Joan Bennett Kennedy : The 411 (& much more !)

Full name : Virginia Joan Bennett (named after her mother)

Nickname : Joansie

Date of birth : September 2, 1936

Birthplace : Mother Cabrini Hospital, Manhattan, New York City

Hometown : Bronxville, New York

Residence : Boston, Massachusetts and Cape Cod, Massachusetts

Height : 5′7 ½

Weight : 132 pounds (1957)

Measurements : 36-inch bust, 25-inch waist, 37-inch hips (1957)

Size : 8

Parents : Harry Wiggin Bennett Jr. (1907-1981) and Virginia Joan ‘Ginny’ Stead (1911-1976). They married on June 8, 1935 and later divorced.

Sibling : Candace ‘Candy’ Bennett McMurrey (b. July 1938)

Religion : Catholicism (her father was a Protestant and her mom a Catholic)

Rank in the family : First born

Alma Mater : Bronxville High (graduated in June 54), Manhattanville College of the Sacred Heart, Purchase, NY (graduated in 58) & Lesley College (1982)

Majors : Music & English (58), Master’s Degree in Education (82)

Favorite subject : Music

Worst subject : Current Events

College roommate : Margot Murray (Ted & Joan met because of her)

Introduction to Society : At the fifth annual Gotham Ball and at the 19th Debutante Cotillion and Christmas Ball (1954, NYC)

Pageant Titles : Bermuda’s College Queen (1955) & Queen of Bermuda’s Floral Pageant (1956)

Modeling Agency : Harry Conover Agency

Modeling Agent : Candy Jones (Conover’s wife)

Modeling jobs : The Revlon Girl on the Perry Como show, “Coke Time” with Eddie Fisher, etc. Joan’s modeling career lasted 18 months and she made many thousand dollars.

Favorite sport : Swimming (she swam 20 laps daily (the equivalent of one mile) in her own pool or at the Watergate when it was cold outside)

Allergy : Horses

Talents & skills : Piano, excellent seamstress, better cook than Jackie & Ethel (lol)

First met Ted : At the Gym dedication ceremony, Manhatthanville College (1957)

First date with her future husband : A luncheon date in New York during Thanksgiving (1957)

Engagement announcement : September 21, 1958 (but he actually proposed in June)

Wedding date : November 29th, 1958, at St. Joseph’s Roman Catholic Church in Bronxville

Dress : A gown of ivory satin, with a sweetheart neckline adorned with rosepoint lace and a fitted bodice, with long sleeves and full skirt

Officiator : Cardinal Spellman (Joan wanted Father John Cavanaugh, “the best priest-friend Ted and I ever had”, but Joe Kennedy said no)

Maid of honor : Candy, Joan’s sister

Best man : JFK

Number of guests : Nearly 500

Honeymoon : A few days at Lord Beaverbrook’s estate in Nassau (Bahamas)

Spouse : Senator Edward M. Kennedy (1958–1982)

Children : Kara Anne Kennedy (b. 1960), Edward M. Kennedy Jr. (b. 1961) & Patrick Joseph Kennedy II (b. 1967)

Senate friends : Marvella Bayh (Senator Birch Bayh’s wife), with whom she campaigned in ‘68, Mieke Tunney (Senator John Tunney’s wife, John Tunney was Ted’s bff)

Pet : A poodle named Rusty (during the 60s)

Personal secretary : Theresa Dubbs

Favorite designers : Oleg Cassini, Oscar de la Renta, Galanos, Zuckerman, Mollie Parnis and Adele Simpson

Houses : “A skinny, narrow Boston browstone” in Charles River Square near Beacon Hill (Boston) - 70 000$, she loved that house (”I thought that’s where we would settle down, but it didn’t turn out that way at all”), a three-bedroom house on Barracks Road in Charlottesville (rental), a four-bedroom summer hose on Squaw Island, a four-bedroom red-brick home at 1336 31st Street in Georgetown (rental), the next year they rented a much larger house at 1607 28th Street, the McLean 10-bedroom family home (Virginia), the Beacon Hill apartment (she has lived there since 1977)

Fun facts : 1) Rose used to call her several times a day to give her tips (oh boy) and ask about the children - she called Ethel frequently too 2) Was once named at the top of Art Buchwald’s list of ‘Washington’s Ten Most Beautiful Women’ 3) She was thrifty - she frequently bought copies of famous designer’s creations. Joe reallllly like that in her ;) 4) When she found something special, she bought it for Ted as a present, like this 1820 Staffordshire pitcher 5) She collected signed letters from all the United States senators from Massachusetts. She also collected fine furniture and hand-carved duck decoys 6) Joan had favorite clothes and wore them more than once. Kandy Stroud, a fashion expert, said “I’ve seen her a thousand times in the same dress. I’d say to her ‘I’ve seen that dress before’ and she’d say ‘I know, but I love it’ and she’d wear it over and over” 7) She didn’t even know who were the Kennedys when she first met Ted because she wasn’t interested in politics (her current events class was her worst)
